definition: to lock (a door)/to close with a latch/to lock into place/a lock/a latch/to lock a computer file (to prevent it being overwritten)/to lock (denying access to a computer system or device or files, e.g. by password-protection)/to focus attention on/to target
locked in (with the door locked from the outside)

sentences.english: The last lane is Method, indicating where the lock contends.
sentences.chinese: 最后一列是方法，表明锁竞争是在什么位置发生的。

sentences.english: I heard that when a group of girls tried to escape, they locked them in the rooms and beat them up.
sentences.chinese: 我听说有一群女孩试着逃走，被他们锁在屋子里狠揍。

sentences.english: It is the customer's responsibility to close out hedges if they wish to do so.
sentences.chinese: 这是客户的责任来将锁单平仓，如果他们愿意这么做。

sentences.english: Maybe, Della was alone. She used to lock herself in her own room.
sentences.chinese: 或许，黛拉是孤独的，她总是把自己锁在房间里。

sentences.english: Most boys keep them locked in their lockers and they're turned off.
sentences.chinese: 大多数男孩子把手机锁在储物柜里，并把手机关掉。

sentences.english: As soon as the captain heard the sound of the lock being turned, he stepped forward.
sentences.chinese: 一听到锁的转动声，船长就立刻一步跨世上前去。

sentences.english: The lock release occurs even if the return was caused by an uncaught exception.
sentences.chinese: 即使是未捕获的异常造成了返回，也会发生锁的释放。

sentences.english: I walked to the locked door, the sounds of the crying becoming louder.
sentences.chinese: 我走到锁着的那扇门前，哭声变得更清楚了。

sentences.english: I bought another lock as an additional insurance against thieves.
sentences.chinese: 我又买了一把锁，以加强防贼的安全措施。

sentences.english: Several different types of locks are available, some of them are listed below.
sentences.chinese: 锁具有几种不同的类型，下面列出了其中一些。

sentences.english: We could make thousands of locks a day in, uh, Yale & Towne.
sentences.chinese: 那时候在耶鲁汤尼工厂，我们一天可以生产千把锁。

sentences.english: He can hairpin any door open.
sentences.chinese: 他可以用发夹打开任何门上的锁。

sentences.english: Some might still be locked in aquifers and other form. ations beneath the surface.
sentences.chinese: 有些水也许还被锁在蓄水层和其它地表以下的构造中。

sentences.english: Don't be discouraged, it's often the last key in the bunch that opens the lock.
sentences.chinese: 别灰心，往往是最后一把钥匙才能打开锁。

sentences.english: But the fish gate did the sons of Hassenaah build, who also laid the beams thereof, and set up the doors thereof, the locks thereof, and the bars thereof.
sentences.chinese: 哈西拿的子孙建立鱼门，架横梁，安门扇，和闩锁。

definition: locked in (with the door locked from the outside)
variant of 門閂|门闩[men2 shuan1]
to close (a door)/to turn off (light, electrical equipment etc)
to stand as a goalkeeper/to keep guard on a gate
to open a door (lit. and fig.)/to open for business
